organic_results.title: Religious socialization and female subjectivity: Religious-Zionist adolescent girls in Israel
organic_results.snippet: The study presented here probed the link between religiosity, gender, and subjectivity in religious Zionist education in Israel, an educational system that faces the challenge of reproducing traditional Jewish conceptions of womanhood in a modern, secular society. Through an interpretative case study of an all-girls' religious boarding high school, the authors explored how the students translated into their daily experiences and subjectivity the religious conception of womanhood that is filtered through educational practices. The …

publication_info.summary: T Rapoport, Y Garb, A Penso - Sociology of Education, 1995 - JSTOR
